pages.title: Phorusracos
pages.text: Phorusrhacos ($(o) FOR-əs-RAH-koss$()) is an extinct genus of giant flightless terror birds that inhabited Argentina during the Miocene epoch.$(br2)Phorusrhacos was one of the dominant land predators in South America at the time it existed.$(br2)It is thought to have lived in woodlands and grasslands.

pages.title: Phorusracos
pages.text: Relative Size: ★★★☆☆$(br2)Active during Daytime$(br2)1 Colors$(br2)Favourite Food: minecraft:rabbit$(br2)Number of Offspring: 5$(br2)Growth time: None Days
